title: Interpreting and Evaluating Experimental Results with Graphing

content.question: RH is a hormone that binds to the RH receptor in the plasma membrane and affects cell division. Researchers studying cancer have identified a chemical, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <semantics> <mrow> <mtext>M9</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8vrps0lbbf9q8GipeeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeaabaqaaeaadaaakeaacaqGnbGaaeyoaaaa@32FE@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, that performs the same role as RH, and they were interested in the effect of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <semantics> <mrow> <mtext>M9</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8vrps0lbbf9q8GipeeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeaabaqaaeaadaaakeaacaqGnbGaaeyoaaaa@32FE@</annotation> </semantics> </math> on the growth of cancer cells. Part A. Describe one property of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <semantics> <mrow> <mtext>M9</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8vrps0lbbf9q8GipeeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeaabaqaaeaadaaakeaacaqGnbGaaeyoaaaa@32FE@</annotation> </semantics> </math> that allows it to perform the same role as RH. In the first experiment, the researchers treated cancer cells growing in a petri dish with either solvent alone or solvent and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <semantics> <mrow> <mtext>M9</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8vrps0lbbf9q8GipeeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeaabaqaaeaadaaakeaacaqGnbGaaeyoaaaa@32FE@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. They used gel electrophoresis to determine the effect of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <semantics> <mrow> <mtext>M9</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8vrps0lbbf9q8GipeeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeaabaqaaeaadaaakeaacaqGnbGaaeyoaaaa@32FE@</annotation> </semantics> </math> on the production of six proteins. The six proteins include two cyclin proteins (cyclin <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <semantics> <mn>1</mn> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8vrps0lbbf9q8GipeeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeaabaqaaeaadaaakeaacaaIXaaaaa@322D@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and cyclin <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <semantics> <mn>2</mn> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8vrps0lbbf9q8GipeeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeaabaqaaeaadaaakeaacaaIXaaaaa@322D@</annotation> </semantics> </math>), two cyclin-dependent kinases (<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <semantics> <mrow> <mtext>CDKA</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8vrps0lbbf9q8GipeeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeaabaqaaeaadaaakeaacaqGdbGaaeiraiaabUeacaqGbbaaaa@3491@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <semantics> <mrow> <mtext>CDKB</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8vrps0lbbf9q8GipeeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeaabaqaaeaadaaakeaacaqGdbGaaeiraiaabUeacaqGbbaaaa@3491@</annotation> </semantics> </math>), the tumor suppressor protein <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <semantics> <mrow> <mtext>TS</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8vrps0lbbf9q8GipeeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeaabaqaaeaadaaakeaacaqGdbGaaeiraiaabUeacaqGbbaaaa@3491@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, and actin, a protein typically expressed equally in all cells. The thickness of the line in the figure indicates a higher concentration of protein. Relative Amounts of Six Proteins in Cancer Cells Treated with Solvent Alone or Solvent and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <semantics> <mrow> <mtext>M9</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8vrps0lbbf9q8GipeeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeaabaqaaeaadaaakeaacaqGnbGaaeyoaaaa@32FE@</annotation> </semantics> </math> In the second experiment, the researchers investigated the effect of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <semantics> <mrow> <mtext>M9</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8vrps0lbbf9q8GipeeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeaabaqaaeaadaaakeaacaqGnbGaaeyoaaaa@32FE@</annotation> </semantics> </math> on apoptosis. They incubated cancer cells with solvent alone or with increasing concentrations of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <semantics> <mrow> <mtext>M9</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8vrps0lbbf9q8GipeeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeaabaqaaeaadaaakeaacaqGnbGaaeyoaaaa@32FE@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and then determined the percentage of cells undergoing apoptosis in each treatment group relative to the control as shown in the table. Cells Undergoing Apoptosis After Treatment with <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <semantics> <mrow> <mtext>M9</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8vrps0lbbf9q8GipeeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeaabaqaaeaadaaakeaacaqGnbGaaeyoaaaa@32FE@</annotation> </semantics> </math> Concentration of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <semantics> <mrow> <mtext>M9</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8vrps0lbbf9q8GipeeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeaabaqaaeaadaaakeaacaqGnbGaaeyoaaaa@32FE@</annotation> </semantics> </math> Percentage of Cells Undergoing Apoptosis, Relative to the Control (<math alttext="plus or minus S E sub x bar" overflow="scroll"> <mo>±</mo> <mn>2</mn> <msub> <mi>SE</mi> <mover accent="true"> <mi>x</mi> <mo>¯</mo> </mover> </msub> </math>) 0 nM (Control) 100 50 nM 110 ± 5 200 nM 95 ± 6 1,000 nM 92 ± 3 5,000 nM 85 ± 4
